issue.title: Minimal Package Documentation
issue.description: The __init__.py file contains only a minimal docstring without explaining the module's purpose, available exports, or usage patterns
issue.recommendation: Add comprehensive module documentation including available routers, utilities, and usage examples

issue.title: Empty Module Initialization
issue.description: The __init__.py file is essentially empty with no explicit exports defined using __all__
issue.recommendation: Define __all__ to explicitly control what is exported from the module and consider importing commonly used routers for easier access

issue.title: Placeholder Module
issue.description: The module appears to be a placeholder with no actual functionality implemented
issue.recommendation: Either implement router utilities and exports or remove if not needed

review.summary: This is an __init__.py file for the common routers module containing only a minimal docstring. The file serves as a Python package initializer but currently provides no functionality, exports, or router utilities.

positive_observations.observation: File includes a docstring following Python conventions
Clean and minimal with no unnecessary code
No security vulnerabilities or performance issues

context.tests: No tests found for this module
context.documentation: Minimal docstring present but lacks detail
context.configuration: Part of common routers package structure
